## Primary Purpose
Package metadata definition file for the `requests` HTTP library. This file serves as the canonical source for version information and package metadata that can be imported by other modules and used by packaging tools.

## Key Components

### Package Metadata Constants (L5-14)
- `__title__` (L5): Package name identifier "requests"
- `__description__` (L6): Human-readable package description
- `__url__` (L7): Documentation URL pointing to readthedocs.io
- `__version__` (L8): Semantic version string "2.32.3"
- `__build__` (L9): Hexadecimal build number (0x023203 = 143875 decimal)
- `__author__` & `__author_email__` (L10-11): Package maintainer information
- `__license__` (L12): Apache-2.0 license identifier
- `__copyright__` (L13): Copyright notice
- `__cake__` (L14): Decorative Unicode emoji string (‚ú®üç∞‚ú®)

## Dependencies
No external dependencies - pure metadata constants only.

## Architectural Role
Standard Python package metadata pattern following PEP conventions. This file enables:
- Version introspection via `import requests.__version__`
- Setup.py/pyproject.toml integration for packaging
- Runtime version checking and compatibility validation

## Usage Pattern
Typically imported by the main package `__init__.py` and accessed via `requests.__version__` or similar attributes. The hexadecimal `__build__` provides more granular version tracking than semantic versioning alone.
